context: The Finnish verb 'odottaa' means 'to wait', 'to await', or 'to expect'. It is a transitive verb, often used atelic (meaning it describes an ongoing action without a specific endpoint). The word can also mean 'to be pregnant' when used transitively.  The form 'odottaa' is the present tense indicative third-person singular form, and also the infinitive/lemma form of the verb. You will find different conjugations depending on the person and tense.
